alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Franklin, northwestern Morris, northern Titus and southeastern Red River Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Vernon, or 11 miles southwest of Hagansport, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Hagansport, Boxelder, Mount Vernon, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Wilkerson, Winfield, Talco, Miller`s Cove and Harts Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Texas.
